entry.title: AMS3 MongoDB Managed Database Maintenance
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Aug 26, 20:30 - 21:00 UTC

Aug 26, 20:17 UTC
Scheduled - During the window of 20:30 UTC to 21:00 UTC, our engineering team will be making changes to our MongoDB Managed Databases product in AMS3 to improve performance.

Expected Impact:

All create and destroy events, as well as adding and removing users for MongoDB Managed Databases in our AMS3 region will be temporarily disabled during maintenance.

We do not anticipate any impact for existing MongoDB Managed Databases.

Do not hesitate to contact support by opening a ticket if you have any additional questions or concerns.

entry.title: MongoDB Cluster Create/Destroy Timeouts
entry.content:
Aug 25, 03:30 UTC
Resolved - Our engineering team has resolved the issue with MongoDB clusters. Create and destroy actions should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Aug 25, 03:02 UTC
Monitoring - Our engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with MongoDB cluster creates and destroys timing out and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

Aug 25, 01:42 UTC
Identified - Our engineering team has identified an issue with MongoDB cluster creates and destroys timing out and is actively working on a fix. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

entry.content:

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. We apologize for any inconvenience caused.

Monitoring - Our Engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with Block Storage Volumes in our FRA1 region, and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

During this time, some users may experience errors or degraded performance while working with Volumes in FRA1. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once more information is available.

entry.title: Droplet Events in AMS2
entry.content:
Aug 18, 20:15 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has completely resolved the issues affecting Droplet events in our AMS2 region and all events should now be processing normally. Thanks for your patience throughout this process. If you continue to experience problems, then please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel.

Aug 18, 19:56 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issues with Droplet events in our AMS2 region and is currently monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

Aug 18, 19:35 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with processing Droplet Creation, Destroy, and Resize events in our AMS2 region. During this time users may experience failed events when creating, resizing, or deleting Droplets or Droplet-backed services, such as Managed Databases, Managed Kubernetes, Load Balancer, etc. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

entry.title: Managed Database Functionality
entry.content:
Aug 17, 18:44 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has resolved the issue affecting the Managed Database service. The deployment and resize events are now getting completed with maximum success rate. We appreciate your patience during the process and if you continue to experience difficulties, please open a ticket with our Support team for further review.

Aug 17, 18:11 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has deployed a fix to resolve the issues affecting our Managed Databases product component. The creation and resize events for the MongoDB clusters should now be functioning normally. We are continuing to monitor the situation and will share an update once the matter is completely resolved.

Aug 17, 17:44 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team is investigating an issue impacting our Managed Databases product. During this time, users may experience delays during the deployment and resize events for MongoDB clusters from the Cloud Control Panel. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have further information.

entry.title: Managed Databases Functionality
entry.content:

Aug 16, 12:50 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has observed that the issues with Managed Databases accessibility and management on our platform are largely fixed. We are continuing to monitor the situation closely. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share another update once the matter is fully resolved.

Aug 16, 12:24 UTC
Identified - Our Engineering team has identified an issue impacting our Managed Databases product. During this time, users may experience errors on the Database page in the Cloud Panel. Users may also notice 5xx errors when performing CRUD actions on the Managed Databases via API. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

entry.title: Networking maintenance in NYC3
entry.content:
Aug 14, 08:15 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Aug 14, 05:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Aug 14, 02:59 UTC
Scheduled - To mitigate the network problems in NYC3 we will be performing an emergency software upgrade of routers commencing at 05:00 UTC and concluding at 09:00 UTC on Saturday 14th August 2021. During this time minimal impact is expected, but users may experience brief moments of packet loss or increased latency.

entry.title: Network Outage in NYC3
entry.content:
Aug 14, 07:43 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has resolved the issue with networking in our NYC3 region. Networking service should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Aug 13, 21:19 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has implemented a fix for the issues that caused an impact on multiple products. We are continuing to monitor the situation closely. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share another update once the matter is fully resolved.

Aug 13, 20:58 UTC
Identified - Our engineering team has identified the cause of the networking issue with our NYC3 region and is actively working on a fix.
We will post an update as soon as possible

Aug 13, 20:51 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team is currently investigating an issue impacting multiple products. During this time, users may experience errors when interacting with Cloud Control Panel, API, and our Community platform. Users may see issues when accessing the Container Registry systems as well. There may be authentication issues for users with Managed Kubernetes clusters. Users may see connectivity issues with their Droplets in the NYC3 region as well. We apologize for any inconvenience and will share more information as soon as it's available.

entry.title: Networking maintenance in SFO1
entry.content:
Jul 21, 12:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jul 21, 08:01 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jul 21, 07:23 UTC
Scheduled - During the above window, the networking team will be making changes to our core networking equipment to improve performance and support future functionality in the SFO1 region.

Expected Impact:

All resource management events in SFO1 will be temporarily disabled during maintenance.

We do not anticipate an impact to connectivity for existing Droplets, on either public or private networks, however, you will not be able to perform management events such as power cycle, snapshot, or destroys for the duration of events being disabled.

Do not hesitate to contact support if you have any additional questions or concerns; you may do so by opening a ticket or replying to this email.
